column5: Last week we went for some bass fishing. The morning weather was calm and good for top-water bait. First cast – nothing. I threw a lure and started to “walk-a-dog”, then from out of nowhere seagull fell down and took the walker…After landing the fish (pardon, bird) to the boat, we’ve carefully extracted hook from a leg and let her go.    Zara Spook must be a very good lure if even seagulls believe it’s wounded minnow
I caught one as well...the fight flight kinda disappointed me though...LOL.

Ive caught a few in my life. One time behind Preston Arena on the Grand while fishing a Pop-r I caught one and while he was fighting another one came down and tried to take the lure out of its mouth and I ended up catching two at once. It made it easier getting them in but much harder getting them off without getting pecked.
caught a few pelican in my day, and last year a loon...the time I hooked into an ostrich though, now that's a episode I don't need to re-live.
I watched Easton catch one, and I don't think I have ever laughed so hard fishing in my life before.  Thanks for posting, that made me smile!  Cheers,  Jen
With a just a pinch of alewife and hard metals..  mmmmmm!!  HAHHAAHA..  comic relief made this a bit less bizarre..  cheers brotha HD
